header: ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. MISC. APPLICATION No. 5/2019 (Pralhad Govindrao Salunkhe Patil etc. 3 Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01-000027-2019

background.text: 1) Present application is filed by the applicants under section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 apprehending their arrest in C.R.No. 355/2018 registered at Lonand Police Station, at the instance of Manda Pandharinath Dhumal, for the offence punishable under Section 306 r/w 34 of Indian Penal Code,1860 and hence have approached Court seeking preÂ­arrest bail.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of criminal procedure code
under section 306 r/w 34 of indian penal code

arguments.text: 2) It is stated that, applicant no. 1 is chairman of New Phaltan Sugar Works Ltd. and applicant no. 2,3 are Directors of said Company. The Company is registered under Companies Act. Applicants are not responsible for alleged offence. Applicants have filed this application on the ground that due to expansion of project and additional construction made at Sugar factory Company sustained losses, due to critical financial problem Company decided to sale Sugar factory. There is no question of abatement to any person to commit suicide and investigation there of, so the custodial interrogation is not necessary. Applicant nos. 1,2 are old persons suffering from Sugar and High blood pressure. They are ready to abide by the conditions imposed while granting bail.

argumentSentences.text: 2) It is stated that, applicant no. 1 is chairman of New Phaltan Sugar Works Ltd. and applicant no. 2,3 are Directors of said Company.
The Company is registered under Companies Act.
Applicants are not responsible for alleged offence.

Applicants have filed this application on the ground that due to expansion of project and additional construction made at Sugar factory Company sustained losses, due to critical financial problem Company decided to sale Sugar factory.
There is no question of abatement to any person to commit suicide and investigation there of, so the custodial interrogation is not necessary.
Applicant nos. 1,2 are old persons suffering from Sugar and High blood pressure.
They are ready to abide by the conditions imposed while granting bail.

arguments.text: 3) Application is opposed by prosecution by filing say at exh. 5, stating that, allegation against applicants are serious. Due to non payment sugarcane bill informant's father namely Bhagwan Maruti Shinde, committed suicide by hanging. The deceased was in need of money for his medical expenses. In spite repeated demands the applicants did not pay the bill of sugarcane to the deceased and deceased committed suicide under frustration.

argumentSentences.text: 3) Application is opposed by prosecution by filing say at exh. 5, stating that, allegation against applicants are serious.
Due to non payment sugarcane bill informant's father namely Bhagwan Maruti Shinde, committed suicide by hanging.
The deceased was in need of money for his medical expenses.
In spite repeated demands the applicants did not pay the bill of sugarcane to the deceased and deceased committed suicide under frustration.

arguments.text: 4) Heard advocate for applicants and Ld. App.

argumentSentences.text: 4) Heard advocate for applicants and Ld. App.

arguments.text: 5) Considering the nature of offence and allegation made in FIR custodial interrogation of the applicants is not required. Admittedly the sugarcane bills of many of the farmers were not paid by the Company of the applicants due to the sustaining loss in Company business. Applicants were not in direct contact of the deceased. In view of allegations in FIR custodial interrogation of the applicants is not required. Considering, these facts the adÂ­interim preÂ­arrest bail granting the applicants may be confirmed. Hence, I proceed to pass following order.

argumentSentences.text: 5) Considering the nature of offence and allegation made in FIR custodial interrogation of the applicants is not required.
Admittedly the sugarcane bills of many of the farmers were not paid by the Company of the applicants due to the sustaining loss in Company business.
Applicants were not in direct contact of the deceased.
In view of allegations in FIR custodial interrogation of the applicants is not required.
Considering, these facts the adÂ­interim preÂ­arrest bail granting the applicants may be confirmed.
Hence, I proceed to pass following order.

order.text: ORDER 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 5/2019, is allowed. 2) Interim preÂ­arrest bail order dated 03/01/2019 passed below Exh. 4, stands confirmed. 3) Applicants to attend to concerned police station as and when called.

processedText:
ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. MISC. APPLICATION No. 5/2019 (Pralhad Govindrao Salunkhe Patil etc. 3 Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01-000027-2019 
---header-ends---
1) Present application is filed by the applicants under section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 apprehending their arrest in C.R.No. 355/2018 registered at Lonand Police Station, at the instance of Manda Pandharinath Dhumal, for the offence punishable under Section 306 r/w 34 of Indian Penal Code,1860 and hence have approached Court seeking preÂ­arrest bail. 
---background-ends---
2) It is stated that, applicant no. 1 is chairman of New Phaltan Sugar Works Ltd. and applicant no. 2,3 are Directors of said Company. The Company is registered under Companies Act. Applicants are not responsible for alleged offence. Applicants have filed this application on the ground that due to expansion of project and additional construction made at Sugar factory Company sustained losses, due to critical financial problem Company decided to sale Sugar factory. There is no question of abatement to any person to commit suicide and investigation there of, so the custodial interrogation is not necessary. Applicant nos. 1,2 are old persons suffering from Sugar and High blood pressure. They are ready to abide by the conditions imposed while granting bail. 
---argument-ends---
3) Application is opposed by prosecution by filing say at exh. 5, stating that, allegation against applicants are serious. Due to non payment sugarcane bill informant's father namely Bhagwan Maruti Shinde, committed suicide by hanging. The deceased was in need of money for his medical expenses. In spite repeated demands the applicants did not pay the bill of sugarcane to the deceased and deceased committed suicide under frustration. 
---argument-ends---
4) Heard advocate for applicants and Ld. App. 
---argument-ends---
5) Considering the nature of offence and allegation made in FIR custodial interrogation of the applicants is not required. Admittedly the sugarcane bills of many of the farmers were not paid by the Company of the applicants due to the sustaining loss in Company business. Applicants were not in direct contact of the deceased. In view of allegations in FIR custodial interrogation of the applicants is not required. Considering, these facts the adÂ­interim preÂ­arrest bail granting the applicants may be confirmed. Hence, I proceed to pass following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 5/2019, is allowed. 2) Interim preÂ­arrest bail order dated 03/01/2019 passed below Exh. 4, stands confirmed. 3) Applicants to attend to concerned police station as and when called. 
---order-ends---
(B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 26th June, 2019 Satara.
